result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Gary S Gray was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: On December 7, 2016 Court amends the JOC to include the $250.00 surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary S Gray

records.addlTxt:
1:39 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court goes over agreement - will plea to count 1 and count 2 will be dismissed.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court has received a copy of the sentencing memorandum.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court dismisses 2014TR1114.

Court sentences the defendant to:  2 years of Initial confinement and 2 years of Extended Supervision.

CONDITIONS:

$600 fine plus court costs
Blood Draw Fee - $96.75
D.L. revocation - 3 years
IID - 3 years
AODA

Court orders sentence to commence immediately.

Corut finds the defendant eligible for the CIP & SAR programs.

Court remands the defendant to the custody of the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

NO sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 1:57 p.m.
SENTENCING MEMORANDUM

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.

2014CF110 - 2014TR1114

2014CF110
Attorney Privat confirms receipt of the complaint - waives reading.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court finds probable cause.  

Court orders bond set at $1,000 signature bond with the conditions of:    Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.   Not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.

Attorney Privat waives preliminary hearing on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing - defendant waives this right - court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.

DA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Privat.  Attorney Privat confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading.  Court makes statement regarding the minimum/maxiumum penalties.

Attorney Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.

Court directs Status Hearing to be set.

2014TR1114
Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.

Court adjourned at 1:25 p.m.
By Atty Barbara Privat
Initial appearance on October 20, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

8:49 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs Defendant of his right to an attorney.  Statement by Defendant, has public Defender.  Court orders Defendant to complete processing.  Court adjourns to a time when the Public Defender will be here.
